page.title: 18Uplands School Expeditions
page.content:
To let the children get a 'feel'for the area the two older classes were taken on a bus-ride and then walked back down the Dillay Valley.Here are some of their impressions: {Uplands School off on a coach {To do our Domesday Project, {So still-so green {And a little-little stream {Is our Domesday Project. {So muddy-so green {By the dark little stream. {So quiet-so nice. Benji Keene
Do you know the poem"only the yellow rose bush knows/How nice mud feels between the toes"?I don't think that's right.I mean...think about where we went!Woods and nettles on either side- and swamps and marshes on the path.I shall never go there again!(unless I have Wellies). { Claire Hearfield
